title: What is the ideal temperature for keeping greens, mushrooms, spring onions, berries, carrots, celery, cucumbers, and cruciferous veggies fresh the longest altogether in one dedicated small refrigerator? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m unaware of research on this, but I’d say it’s in the range of 35–38 degrees. Humidity and air flow are also factors to consider.
It's not as simple as putting all your vegetables in the fridge. Some need storage outside the fridge. Some need preparation. See here How to Store Vegetables to Keep them Fresh
